column1: A nasal mucosal biopsy is the removal of a small piece of tissue from the lining of the nose so that it can be checked for disease.
It may also be done when the health care provider suspects you have a problem affecting the mucosal tissue of the nose.
- Cancer - Infections, such as tuberculosis - Necrotizing granuloma, a type of tumor - Nasal polyps - Nasal tumors - Sarcoidosis - Wegener's disease (Wegener's granulomatosis)
